intro: Diplocaulobium savannicola, commonly known as the savanna dwarf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the grasslands of South America. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as savannas and disturbed soils, where it forms dense clumps of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread vegetatively and colonize new areas. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikelets, and it produces minute seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its adaptation to fire-prone environments, it plays a significant role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
